properties.areaDesc: Belknap, NH; Merrimack, NH; Rockingham, NH; York, ME; Strafford, NH
properties.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 8 at 5:13PM EST until January 8 at 6:00PM EST by NWS Gray ME
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Gray Maine has issued a

* Snow Squall Warning for...
Southwestern York County in southwestern Maine...
Central Rockingham County in southern New Hampshire...
Strafford County in central New Hampshire...
Southeastern Belknap County in central New Hampshire...
Southeastern Merrimack County in central New Hampshire...

* Until 600 PM EST.

* At 513 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line
extending from near Farmington to near Hooksett, moving east,
southeast at 30 mph. Visibilities below a quarter mile can be
expected with snow will rapidly accumulate on roadways, leading to
trechorous driving conditions.

HAZARD...Snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 30 mph.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Expect hazardous road conditions.

This includes the following highways...
Interstate 89 between mile markers 0 and 3.
Interstate 93 between mile markers 34 and 43.
Interstate 95 between mile markers 1 and 16.
Interstate 95 in New Hampshire between mile markers 2 and 16.

This also includes...
Hampton Beach, York Beach, and Ogunquit Beach.

Locations impacted include...
Concord, Rochester, Portsmouth, Hampton, Durham, Exeter, Kittery,
Northwood, Dover, Hooksett, Somersworth, Barrington, Berwick,
Farmington, Epping, Lebanon, Loudon, Alton, Barnstead and Epsom.
properties.instruction:
Travel is not advised during this dangerous snow squall.  Rapid
visibility reduction and potentially icy roads are likely to lead to
accidents.  Consider delaying travel until the squall passes your
location.  If traveling, pull off to a safe location and turn your
headlights on.

Temperatures are above freezing, but sharply colder temperatures
following the snow will cause any water or slush to quickly freeze on
roads and sidewalks.  Untreated road surfaces will become extremely
slippery.  Reduced speeds and increased distance between vechicles is
advised.

CMAMtext: Snow Squall Warning til 6:00 PM EST. Sudden whiteouts. Icy roads. Slow down! -NWS
